inscription:
Dancer Shizuka (Shizuka gozen):
Shizuka is a daughter Iso, a zen monk, an extraordinarily beautiful woman, a master of {otoko-mai} (men\'s dancing). She was loved by Yoshitsune. After Yoshitsune was expelled, she was held in Yoshino mountain and was sent back to Kamakura, separating from Yoshitsune. When she left Yoshino, she made a poem in tears;
(At Yoshino Mountain
The footsteps on the new snow
Makes me think the person
Who had to go without me
The person I miss so much)
{Iso no zenshi ga musume nari. Yōbō tagui naku, otko-mai no jōzu nite sono na takashi. Yoshitsune no chōai ni yori Yoshino nite ?? ni mukau to no nozomi, namida nagara ni ??? no uta wo eiji ke ru:
Yoshino yama
Toma? no shirayuki 
Furi wakete
Iri fushi hito to
Ato no koishi ki}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper

title: Evening Snow at Yoshino
